A pixel-perfect macOS-inspired dark theme React component library.
Build stunning, production-ready dark themed interfaces with pixel-perfect glass-morphism. React 19 + Tailwind v4.
A versatile container component with glass-morphism styling, widely used for grouping content.

import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { CardPreview } from '../../../components/ComponentPreview'; The Card component serves as the fundamental building block for layout, providing a surface to group related content. It features a sophisticated glass material effect that adapts to the background. ## Live Preview
## Installation ```bash npx shadcn add https://darwin-ui.mandalsuraj.com/registry/card.json ``` ```bash npm install @smc/darwin-ui ``` ## Usage ```tsx title="src/components/ProfileCard.tsx" import { Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardContent, CardFooter, Button } from '@smc/darwin-ui'; export function ProfileCard() { return ( Create project

Deploy your new project in one-click.
{/* Form fields */}
); } ``` ## Structure The Card component typically consists of the following sub-components: - `Card`: The main container with border and background. - `CardHeader`: Wrapper for title and description. - `CardTitle`: The primary heading. - `CardDescription`: Secondary text for context. - `CardContent`: The main body area. - `CardFooter`: Bottom area, usually for actions. ## API Reference
Component Prop Type Description
`Card` `className` `string` Additional class names for the container.
`CardHeader` `className` `string` Wrapper for the header section.
`CardTitle` `as` `ElementType` The semantic HTML heading level (default: `h3`).
`CardContent` `className` `string` Wrapper for the main content.
### Accessibility
Appropriate heading hierarchy with `CardTitle`

Displays a callout for user attention, used for important messages and feedback.

import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { AlertPreview } from '../../../components/ComponentPreview'; The Alert component highlights critical information with distinct visual cues. It supports semantic variants for success, warning, error, and informational messages. ## Live Preview
## Installation ```bash npx shadcn add https://darwin-ui.mandalsuraj.com/registry/alert.json ``` ```bash npm install @smc/darwin-ui ``` ## Usage ```tsx import { Alert, AlertTitle, AlertDescription } from '@smc/darwin-ui'; import { Terminal } from 'lucide-react'; export function Example() { return ( Heads up! You can add components to your app using the cli. ); } ``` ## Variants
Variant Visual Style Description
`default` Gray glass background Standard announcements.

import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; Charts in Darwin UI are built using Recharts but are heavily styled to match the glass-morphism aesthetic. We provide custom tooltips, axes, and color palettes. ## Installation ```bash npm install recharts ``` ## Area Chart Used for visualizing trends over time, like revenue or traffic. ```tsx import { AreaChart, Area, XAxis, YAxis, CartesianGrid, Tooltip, ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts'; const data = [ { name: 'Jan', value: 4000 }, { name: 'Feb', value: 3000 }, { name: 'Mar', value: 2000 }, { name: 'Apr', value: 2780 }, { name: 'May', value: 1890 }, { name: 'Jun', value: 2390 }, ]; export function RevenueChart() { return (
); } ``` ## Styling Guidelines To maintain the Darwin UI look: 1. **Grid Lines**: Use `stroke="rgba(255,255,255,0.05)"` and `vertical={false}`. 2. **Axes**: Remove axis lines with `axisLine={false}` and `tickLine={false}`. Use muted colors for text. 3. **Tooltips**: Use a custom `contentStyle` with high opacity backing (e.g., `rgba(10,10,10,0.9)`) and a subtle border. 4. **Gradients**: Always use `defs` to create fade-out gradients for area fills.

## shadcn CLI Installation

Install individual components directly into your project:

```bash
# Add a single component
npx shadcn add https://darwin-ui.mandalsuraj.com/registry/button.json

# Add multiple components
npx shadcn add https://darwin-ui.mandalsuraj.com/registry/card.json
npx shadcn add https://darwin-ui.mandalsuraj.com/registry/table.json
```

## Basic Setup

### 1. Import Styles

Add the Darwin UI styles to your application:

```tsx
// In your main entry file (App.tsx, main.tsx, etc.)
import '@smc/darwin-ui/styles';
```

Or in your CSS file:

```css
@import '@smc/darwin-ui/styles';
```

### 2. Use Components

```tsx
import { Button, Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardContent } from '@smc/darwin-ui';

function App() {
  return (
    <Card>
      <CardHeader>
        <CardTitle>Hello Darwin UI</CardTitle>
      </CardHeader>
      <CardContent>
        <Button variant="primary">Click me</Button>
      </CardContent>
    </Card>
  );
}
```

### 3. Setup Providers (Optional)

For components that require context (Toast, Alert, Modal), wrap your app with providers:

```tsx
import { ToastProvider, AlertProvider, OverlayProvider } from '@smc/darwin-ui';

function App() {
  return (
    <OverlayProvider>
      <ToastProvider>
        <AlertProvider>
          <YourApp />
        </AlertProvider>
      </ToastProvider>
    </OverlayProvider>
  );
}
```

## Peer Dependencies

Darwin UI requires the following peer dependencies:

```json
{
  "react": "^19.0.0",
  "react-dom": "^19.0.0"
}
```

### Optional: Next.js

Some components (Image, MdEditor, ContextMenu) have Next.js-specific features:

```json
{
  "next": ">=14.0.0"
}
```

## Tailwind CSS Configuration

Darwin UI uses Tailwind CSS v4. Ensure your project has Tailwind configured:

```css
/* globals.css */
@import "tailwindcss";
@import "@smc/darwin-ui/styles";
```

## TypeScript

Darwin UI includes TypeScript declarations. No additional `@types` packages needed.

```tsx
import type { Variant, Size } from '@smc/darwin-ui';

const buttonVariant: Variant = 'primary';
const buttonSize: Size = 'lg';
```
Learn about Darwin UI and its design philosophy.

Darwin UI is a macOS-inspired dark theme React component library featuring glass-morphism aesthetics. It provides a cohesive set of components designed for building beautiful, modern web applications with a premium dark theme feel.

## Design Philosophy

### Dark Theme First
Darwin UI is designed with dark mode as the primary theme, featuring a near-black background (`hsl(0, 0%, 4%)`) that provides excellent contrast and reduces eye strain.

### Glass Morphism
Components utilize backdrop-blur effects, semi-transparent backgrounds (`bg-white/10`), and subtle borders to create a modern glass-like appearance.

### Accessibility
Built on top of Radix UI primitives, ensuring proper ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support.

### Framework Agnostic Design
While some components leverage Next.js features, the core library works with any React 19 project.

## Technology Stack

- **React 19** - Latest React with concurrent features
- **TypeScript** - Full type safety
- **Tailwind CSS v4** - Utility-first styling
- **Radix UI** - Accessible primitives
- **Motion** - Smooth animations (Framer Motion)
- **Recharts** - Data visualization

## What's Included

### 25+ Components
- Layout: Card, Window, Sidebar
- Forms: Button, Input, Select, MultiSelect, Checkbox, Switch
- Data Display: Table, Badge, Skeleton
- Feedback: Modal, Toast, Alert
- Charts: Area, Bar, Line, Pie, Donut, StackedBar
- Utility: ContextMenu, Upload, Image, Reveal

### 4 Custom Hooks
- `useMediaQuery` - Responsive breakpoints
- `useIsMobile` - Mobile detection
- `useEscapeKey` - Keyboard shortcuts
- `useContactForm` - Form handling

### Utilities
- `cn()` - Class name merging with Tailwind
- `OverlayProvider` - Overlay state management

Customize Darwin UI colors and styles.

Darwin UI uses CSS custom properties (variables) for theming, making it easy to customize colors while maintaining the dark theme aesthetic. ## Default Theme The default Darwin UI theme features a near-black background with subtle glass-morphism effects: ```css :root { --background: 0 0% 4%; /* Near black */ --foreground: 0 0% 95%; /* Near white */ --card: 0 0% 6%; /* Slightly lighter */ --card-foreground: 0 0% 95%; --border: 0 0% 15%; /* Subtle borders */ --ring: 217.2 91.2% 59.8%; /* Blue focus ring */ --muted: 0 0% 15%; --muted-foreground: 0 0% 65%; } ``` ## Customizing Colors Override CSS variables in your stylesheet: ```css /* Custom purple accent theme */ :root { --background: 270 50% 4%; --foreground: 270 10% 95%; --card: 270 50% 6%; --ring: 270 91% 60%; /* Purple focus ring */ } ``` ## Component-Specific Styling ### Button Variants Darwin UI buttons support 11 variants with predefined colors: | Variant | Background | Use Case | |---------|------------|----------| | `default` | `bg-white/10` | Neutral actions | | `primary` | `bg-blue-600` | Main CTAs | | `secondary` | `bg-white/5` | Secondary actions | | `success` | `bg-green-600` | Positive actions | | `warning` | `bg-amber-500` | Caution actions | | `destructive` | `bg-red-500/80` | Delete/remove | | `outline` | Transparent + border | Subtle actions | | `ghost` | Transparent | Minimal UI | | `link` | Text only | Inline links | | `accent` | `bg-purple-600` | Highlighted actions | ### Badge Variants Badges have 13 status variants: ```tsx Active Pending Error Published Draft Archived ``` ## Glass Morphism Effects To maintain the glass-morphism aesthetic, use these utility classes: ```tsx // Semi-transparent background with blur
Content
// Glass card effect
Card content
``` ## Chart Colors The charts component uses a predefined color palette: ```tsx const chartColors = { blue: '#60a5fa', green: '#34d399', yellow: '#fbbf24', red: '#f87171', purple: '#a78bfa', pink: '#f472b6', orange: '#fb923c', teal: '#2dd4bf', }; ``` Customize chart colors via props: ```tsx ``` ## Dark Mode Only Darwin UI is designed exclusively for dark themes. The color system assumes a dark background and uses light foreground colors for text and icons. If you need light mode support, you'll need to implement your own theme switching logic and override the CSS variables accordingly.
